climbs.name: Wildest Dreams
climbs.fa: equipped: S. McCorkel, B. Scott. FA: J. Burckhard

content.description:
From the gully, climb past 3 bolts of 5.8 terrain using extra long slings to reach Steve's original 2-bolt belay anchor. From here, climb past 1 bolt in the slab to finally reach the main head wall.

Launch into a nice 12a intro section to the large, horizontal break. From the break, climb through the first two bolts of

Rustic Wilderness

, and move right after the second. Follow three more bolts up the direct center of the wall. There are multiple cruxes with one marginal rest, and the red point crux is the last few moves on the headwall. Stick the jug out right, clip the recently added last bolt, and then mantel over the lip to clip the anchors which are shared with

Rustic Wilderness

.
content.protection: 14 bolts, extra long slings at the bottom (there are currently fixed rope draws on the first three bolts and a sling on the fourth), and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This route is the center line on the Wild Wall in between

Rustic Wilderness

and

Wild and Scenic

.

content.description:
Wild and Scenic is another stunning, seldom repeated Steve McCorkel route.

From the gully, climb past 3 bolts of 5.8 terrain using extra long slings to reach Steve's original 2-bolt belay anchor. From here, climb past 2 bolts in the slab to finally reach the main wall.

Start by doing a sort of leaning traverse up and left on big jugs. Be careful around the 2nd bolt, because your belayer cannot see you and the ledge/slab are pretty close. Get a rest at the break/horizontal, and pull up into the ramp/arch feature. The climbing is strangely hard to read and pumpy through this large feature. Above the ramp/arch feature lies the real heartbreak crux on small holds with a big throw to the slopey jug next to the chains.
content.protection: 12 bolts, extra long slings for the bottom, 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is the right-most line on the Wild Wall.

climbs.name: Rustic Wilderness
climbs.fa: Equip: S. McCorkel, FA: B. Scott

content.description:
From the gully, climb past 3 bolts of 5.8 terrain using extra long slings to reach Steve's original 2-bolt belay anchor. From here, climb past 2 bolts in the slab to finally reach the main wall.

From here, launch into a nice 12a intro section to the large, horizontal break. From the break, the hard moves just keep coming and coming. Large shouldery moves lead to the 2nd to last bolt and the crux. Make a big move on two small edges to a giant basketball jug. Traverse the jug left, and complete the scary run up the little slab to the anchor.
content.protection: 12 bolts, extra long slings for the bottom, 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is the left-most line on the Wild Wall.
